Articles.Content: The log files can still help. They may not show a crash but they can certainly show various interactions which you be not be aware of.

5 minutes ago, Jiraiyah said:

logs won't help, simply because the game does not crash but the gpu itself gets a crash to black screen and nothing goes into the log before that,

I assume you talk about the error.log which will be created on a game crash but I'm talking about the output_log, which will be written as soon as the game starts and since you got a screenshot which shows the issue, I guess that your game actually still launches and you can enter the game.

Many mod issues are already logged during the loading screen, so a log would actually help

will give it a try tomorrow to see if i find anything to share. right now, it's mid night my brain is already frozen after 6 crashes and restarting the pc

 

hmmm, shouldn't output_log sit under ksp_64_data? there is no output log there at all !

 

well i can tell you this much, using directX 9, the terrain would look ok but still would crash the gpu, using directx11 (for textures unlimited) or opengl, the terrain would get corrupted too. will try to see if i can find any output log tomorrow and be fast to copy ot before the pc crash.

Everytime you execute KSP_x64.exe a KSP.log file is generated in the very same folder where the exe is located. This log file is mandatory to perform any troubleshooting.

4 hours ago, Jiraiyah said:

ok. this is interesting. tried it again and crashed again but no file named output* that indicates a log file under ksp's folder at all !!!

the output_log is kinda hidden: 

%USERPROFILE%\AppData\LocalLow\Squad\Kerbal Space Program\output_log.txt

and the KSP.log is in the same directory as your KSP_x64.exe (in yiur case, it should be in D:\KSP)

I'm pretty sure, that this is your problem: 

KSP_x64.exe -force-d3d11 -popupwindow

KS3P doesn't (officially) support DX11 (IIRC it is planned for the next release) but in the meantime, @jrodriguez build a DX11 compatible version:

KSP itself doesn't officially support DX11, so you'll probably come across some other visual issues and it is something you should always mention if you run into a problem and report it here in the forum

Interesting, didn't know scatterer got issues with dx11 as well.

Hard to say what the reason for the bright sky now, have to guess here:

1) Check be the ambient light settings of Distant Object Enhancement

2) At least for testing purposes, disable the Eye_Adaptation of KS3P in the config file (probably bloom as well but it doesn't look like bloom). Look for: 

        Eye_Adaptation﻿
        {
            Luminosity_Minimum = -8
            Luminosity_Maximum = 4
            Maximum_EV = -5
            Minimum_EV = 1
            Dynamic_Key_Value = True
            Type = 0
            Speed_Up = 2
            Speed_Down = 1
            Range = 0.5,1
            Key_Value = 0.3﻿
        }﻿

in the config file and put a // in front of each line (if you use notepad++, you can mark all lines and press ctrl + k). The entrywill appear multiple times for different scenes (flight, EVA, KSC...), be sure to disable all of them or to check the results in the scene settings you've changed.

 

Well, or try these

Regarding DX11, using my setup ( which has a Dev version of Scatterer with new shaders compiled for dx11) the only issue I have seen so far is a white flickering at certain altitude (<140 km) when using reflective module from Texture Replacer.

i exactly substituted and got the crash that time. but will test the solo scatterer tomorrow and update info

I've been playing around with KS3P this evening and generally I'm liking the visuals, especially bloom and depth of field.

However the default configuration gives an image that is too high contrast for my tastes (specifically too dark in the shaded areas), and I've been unsuccessful in altering it.

Changing the eye adaptation values doesn't seem to have any effect, even when making very large changes to the values, then comparing screenshot to see what difference takes place. If anyone has any suggestions regarding this I'd be grateful.

I'll download Unity 5.4 and the Post Processing Stack to see if I can work this out for myself, but hopefully someone has a suggestion that will save me the trouble.

 

Ok Ignore all that above, I just needed to change the Colour Grading profile from "ACES" to "Neutral".

 

Edited February 24, 2019 by purpleivan

After spending more time with the mod I've come across an issue that I've been unable to solve.

The issue is that I have 5 profiles, each with different depth of field settings. These work fine in flight mode, but when I go to EVA, the profile used reverts to that defines in Target in Settings.cfg. After that I can't change to the others profiles I have defined while in EVA, although I can turn off KS3P and if I hit Alt 8 or 9, the mod's visuals appear again, but again stuck in the single profile.

If I go back to flight mode, after EVA I can use the hotkeys again to change profiles.

I even tried reverting the changes I'd made to the EVA part of the profiles, to the original settings from the mod package, in case I'd screwed something up in them. Then I made a big change to Vignette intensity of one of the profiles' EVA settings so I had some distinct change to look for when switching profiles. However the behaviour was the same as before, no profile change in EVA.

So... any ideas?

I thought I'd post a few images I took today, in my Kerbin Sorta-Circumnavigation mission.

I'm definately liking the extra quality that KS3P is giving them.

I'm using the Neutral Colour Grading profile, as I prefer it to the ACES one, but ideally I'd be able to put together my own that is somewhere between the two in terms of contrast.

Edited February 24, 2019 by purpleivan

This mod is so great.  Been messing with settings and added a film grain effect to the comm center to give it that degraded signal look!

It's been impossible to stop messing around with stuff since I started playing with DoF etc.
